pageProps.content:
Experience

Peering out beneath giant ebony trees, Camp Moremi is situated on the magnificent Xaxanaka Lagoon in the heart of the Moremi Wildlife Reserve within the Okavango Delta.
This area is known to have the best game viewing in Botswana, with superb predator sightings & excellent year-round birding.

Stay

Camp Moremi provides only 11 African-style safari tents, each individually sited on a raised teak platform with private adjacent facilities & viewing deck, most offering unsurpassed views of the Xakanaxa Lagoon.
There is also a luxury family safari tent, consisting of 2 separate bedrooms, 2 bathrooms & a private deck with beautiful views over the Moremi Game Reserve. All tents are en-suite.
An elegant, elevated thatch & timber structure serves as the main building comprising a main sitting area, wildlife reference library, dining room and cocktail bar - inviting a true sense of the African wilderness.
Other facilities include a secluded swimming pool with sundeck & thatched boma where brunch and high tea are served.

Activities

Safari activities consist of morning & late afternoon game drives in open 4x4 vehicles, offering frequent sightings of lion, leopard, cheetah & wild dog. Guests can also explore the Xaxanaka Lagoon & surrounding Okavango channels by motorboat.

subfolders.title: Belmond Khwai River Lodge
subfolders.description: Belmond Khwai River Lodge nestles on the edge of a forest, overlooking the vast floodplains of the Moremi Wildlife Reserve & offers excellent year-round game viewing. Known for its exceptional range of big game, guests have an opportunity to view wildlife from the comfort of their private decks.

subfolders.title: Camp Moremi
subfolders.description: Peering out beneath giant ebony trees, Camp Moremi is situated on the magnificent Xaxanaka Lagoon in the heart of the Moremi Wildlife Reserve within the Okavango Delta. This area is known to have the best game viewing in Botswana, with superb predator sightings & excellent year-round birding.

subfolders.title: Camp Okuti
subfolders.description: Camp Okuti lies alongside the Maunachira River which flows through the Xakanaxa Lagoon within the world-renowned Moremi Game Reserve.   Set in one of Botswana’s prime game viewing areas, Camp Okuti never fails to impress as it is the perfect combination of traditional safari & elegant luxury.  Guests staying at Camp Okuti will be blown away by its unusual hut-type safari accommodation & excellent game viewing.

subfolders.title: Camp Xakanaxa
subfolders.description: A sophisticated tented bush camp of note, Camp Xakanaxa is set in the lush northern region of the Moremi Game Reserve in the Okavango Delta. This unique area is made up of permanent waterways, open savanna, dry woodlands & seasonal floodplains, making this diverse region attractive to a variety of wildlife.

subfolders.title: Hyena Pan Camp
subfolders.description: Hyena Pan Camp boasts a remarkable location in the 200,000-hectare Khwai Private Reserve next to the only permanent water source for miles around, ensuring top-notch wildlife viewing from the comfort of your viewing deck. Due to the camp’s lagoon-front location, it is a magnet for predators & other wildlife, including elephant, buffalo & hordes of plains game.

subfolders.title: Khwai Bush Camp
subfolders.description: Khwai Bush Camp is set in a private community-run concession on the eastern border of the world-renowned Moremi Game Reserve. The Khwai River runs through the concession & offers spectacular views into the untamed wilderness.  The Khwai area comprises varied ecosystems – from forests, grasslands, floodplains & lagoons – offering one of the most consisting areas for wildlife encounters year-round.

subfolders.title: Khwai Leadwood Camp
subfolders.description: Khwai Leadwood Camp is set in a private community-run concession on the eastern border of the world-renowned Moremi Game Reserve. The Khwai River runs through the concession & forms a boundary between the reserve & the community area, allowing for excellent wildlife viewing year-round.  Since the area is generally quite dry, the Khwai River is often the only water source for thirsty animals, allowing for a game-packed safari experience.

subfolders.title: Little Machaba
subfolders.description: Little Machaba is situated in the wildlife-rich Khwai concession in the northeast Okavango adjacent to the Moremi Reserve.   The camp is located on the same island as its sister camp - Machaba Camp but is run separately.  Guests staying at Little Machaba will enjoy a luxury Botswana safari in a 1950’s style setting.

subfolders.title: Little Mombo
subfolders.description: Little Mombo is located on the famous Chief’s Island in the Moremi Wildlife Reserve in Botswana.  The camp is built under a shady canopy of jackalberry & sausage trees & shares the same island as its sister camp, Mombo, overlooking a floodplain that is host to an astonishing variety of wildlife. Due to the abundance of wildlife frequently seen here, the Mombo wildlife area has been given the name “Place of Plenty.”  It is also home to the Botswana Rhino Reintroduction Project.

subfolders.title: Machaba Camp
subfolders.description: Machaba Camp is a colonial-style tented camp nestling in the wildlife-rich Khwai area in the northeastern section of the world-famous Okavango Delta, sharing a westerly border with the Moremi Game Reserve. The camp combines tented luxury & amazing wildlife opportunities, ensuring a wonderful safari experience from start to finish.  Decorated in an understated 1950’s colonial style, Machaba Camp is the perfect choice for the discerning traveller.

subfolders.title: Mankwe Tented Retreat
subfolders.description: Mankwe Tented Retreat boasts an unbeatable setting in a private concession on the doorstep of the game-rich Moremi Game Reserve. The retreat is tucked away in a grove of mopane trees & mysterious woodlands, offering guests the best of both land & water-based safari activities.

subfolders.title: Mma Dinare
subfolders.description: Mma Dinare boasts a spectacular setting in a private concession, adjacent to the Moremi Game Reserve on the southeastern side of the Okavango Delta.   Overlooking the Gomoti River & its floodplains, this eco-friendly camp offers its guests beautiful views & wonderful game viewing opportunities from the comfort of your viewing deck.

subfolders.title: Mombo Camp
subfolders.description: Mombo Camp is located within the Mombo Concession on the tip of Chief’s Island within the Okavango Delta’s Moremi Game Reserve. Everyone knows that this area boasts enormous concentrations of plains game & predators – providing the best game viewing in all of Africa.  Black & white rhino have been reintroduced to the region, so guests have the privilege of seeing the Big 5 up, close & personal.

subfolders.title: Moremi Crossing
subfolders.description: Moremi Crossing is a luxury tented camp built on a palm-fringed island surrounded by the Moremi’s game-rich seasonal floodplains & overlooking Chief’s Island.   The eco-friendly camp combines luxury with simplicity & boasts spectacular views over the Boro River onto Chief’s Island.

subfolders.title: Pelo Camp
subfolders.description: As the name suggests, Pelo means ‘heart’ in Setswana, & from the air, the island on which this beautiful camp is situated appears heart-shaped.   Pelo Camp has been designed to respect the environment, so this light-footprint eco-friendly camp is built from natural materials, operating on 100% solar power & offering low-impact carbon-neutral activities.

subfolders.title: Qorokwe Camp
subfolders.description: Fittingly, the name Qorokwe means “the place where the buffalo broke through the bush into the water,” evoking the high-density game area in which this camp is situated.  Due to the mix of habitats that lie between its western & eastern borders, this region is a magnet for wildlife.

subfolders.title: Rra Dinare
subfolders.description: Rra Dinare (meaning “Father Buffalo”) lies on a private concession adjacent to the Moremi Game Reserve in the southeastern side of the Delta, an area with varied & exciting game viewing. With beautiful views over the Gomoti River & floodplains, Rra Dinare’s scenic setting enjoys a steady stream of wildlife throughout the day.

subfolders.title: Sable Alley Camp
subfolders.description: Sable Alley Camp is set within one of Botswana’s best-kept secrets:  The Khwai Private Concession, offering one of Africa’s greatest & most exclusive safari experiences.  Located on the banks of a lily-covered lagoon that attracts a variety of wildlife like hippo, elephant & buffalo, big game literally comes to you at Sable Alley Camp.

whatWeLoveItems: Located in the heart of the Moremi Reserve
